articles.description: Injuries to Kieran Tierney and Thomas Partey, plus the goals drying up again, have opened Arteta up to scrutiny after he let a string of players leave in January without any new additions.
articles.content:
Mikel Arteta has defended the decision to slash the size of his squad but also revealed his plans to beef it back up again next season.
Injuries to Kieran Tierney and Thomas Partey, plus the goals d… [+1975 chars]

articles.author: Nick Mashiter
articles.title: Steven Gerrard insists that winning silverware at Tottenham would mean more to Harry Kane - Daily Mail
articles.description: Kane initially told Spurs he wanted to leave but City's attempts to sign him ended in failure and the England skipper has scored 33 goals for club and country this term.
articles.content:
Harry Kane can find happiness at Tottenham rather than needing a career quick fix, according to Aston Villa boss Steven Gerrard.

articles.author: Dan Sales, James Robinson
articles.title: Three-time Wimbledon champion Boris Becker found guilty of four charges under the Insolvency Act - Daily Mail
articles.description: Wimbledon champ Boris Becker has been found guilty at Southwark Crown Court of four charges under the Insolvency Act and acquitted of a further 20 counts relating to his 2017 bankruptcy.
articles.content:
Three-time Wimbledon champion Boris Becker is facing a prison sentence of up to seven years after today being found guilty of breaking UK insolvency laws.

articles.author: Kishan Vaghela, Mark Duell
articles.title: British Cycling BAN trans cyclists from racing, while they re-work their policy - Daily Mail
articles.description: British Cycling has suspended its transgender and non-binary participation policy in the aftermath of Emily Bridges' failed attempt to enter a women's event at a UK championships event.
articles.content:
British Cycling today banned transgender riders from competing in national events and vowed to rework its policy which it admitted was 'unfair on all women cyclists'.
